intro: Oedera tricephala, commonly known as the three-headed oedera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, three-parted flower heads that resemble small, clustered blossoms. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Oedera tricephala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
